content:
• Tuesday, July 16, 2013
  • BLLAY

    Shares of Billabong (OTCPK:BLLAY, OTCPK:BLLAF) soar down under, rising 38% on the ASX after the...

    Shares of Billabong (OTCPK:BLLAY, OTCPK:BLLAF) soar down under, rising 38% on the ASX after the company secures $364M in financing and says it will replace its CEO. The package includes $300M in bridge financing (at 12%) and $64.65M for DaKine, Billabong's backpack brand.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • FLOW-OLD

    Flow International (NASDAQ:FLOW-OLD) says its evaluation of strategic alternatives, including a...

    Flow International (NASDAQ:FLOW-OLD) says its evaluation of strategic alternatives, including a potential sale of the company, remains ongoing and it has entered into confidentiality agreements with a number of interested parties. The company also says it's postponing the filing of its FY annual report, citing additional time needed to complete the preparation of financial statements and ensuing audit procedures, primarily related to its Brazilian operations. The company expects to file its annual report within the 15-day extension period. Shares +5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM
  • EGC

    Energy XXI (EXXI) +12.6% AH after providing a fiscal year-end update. The company estimates its...

    Energy XXI (EXXI) +12.6% AH after providing a fiscal year-end update. The company estimates its proved reserves totaled 179 MMBOE at the close of FY13 (ended June 30), +50% Y/Y, and that it had a 390% organic reserve replacement rate. Also, the company averaged production of 47K BOE/day in FQ4, and had an 82% success rate on the first 11 wells drilled via its horizontal drilling program. The present value of proved + probable reserves is estimated at $8.4B.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • EGC

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: EXXI +14%. TRP +4%. FDML +3%. PKG +3%. SMRT +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: EXXI +14%. TRP +4%. FDML +3%. PKG +3%. SMRT +3%.
    After-hours top losers: ZAGG -15%. MSPD -5%. AXP -2%. IBKR -2%. MRGE -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:39 PM
  • PKG

    More on Packaging Corp Of America (NYSE:PKG): Q2 beats on all counts as total sales ramp 12%...

    More on Packaging Corp Of America (NYSE:PKG): Q2 beats on all counts as total sales ramp 12% higher Y/Y, driven by higher prices and higher corrugated products volume. Corrugated products shipments per workday were up 5.2%, and total shipments were up 6.8%, aided by one more workday in the quarter. For Q3, the company guides its EPS slightly ahead of the Street, now expecting an EPS of about $0.88, versus the Street view of $0.87. Shares +2.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • V

    In a move "broadly based on proposed antitrust deals" with Visa (NYSE:V) and MasterCard...

    In a move "broadly based on proposed antitrust deals" with Visa (NYSE:V) and MasterCard (NYSE:MA), the EU proposes a cap on credit and debit card processing fees of 0.2% to be implemented after a two-year "transition period" during which the ceiling will only apply to cross-border charges, FT says. The move is expected to result in a €4.5B reduction in fees, according to the European Commission. V -1.32% and MA -1.66% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM | 14 Comments
  • PKG

    Packaging Corp (NYSE:PKG): Q2 EPS of $0.71 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $800M (+12% Y/Y) beats by...

    Packaging Corp (NYSE:PKG): Q2 EPS of $0.71 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $800M (+12% Y/Y) beats by $30.59M. Shares +4.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • MEAD

    Meade Instruments (NASDAQ:MEAD) terminates its previously announced merger agreement with JOC...

    Meade Instruments (NASDAQ:MEAD) terminates its previously announced merger agreement with JOC North America, and announces new plans to merge with Sunny Optics, an affiliate of Ningbo Sunny Electronic, for $4.21 per share or approximately $5.5M. Shares +11.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • ZAGG

    Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG) resumes trading following its Q2 warning; shares -14.7% AH. CEO Randy Hales...

    Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG) resumes trading following its Q2 warning; shares -14.7% AH. CEO Randy Hales says he's expanding his responsibilities "to assume a leadership role in the execution of [Zagg's] sales plan," in an effort to help right the ship. Full Q2 results arrive on Aug. 1.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) delivers guidance through a slide deck released following its Q2 report. The...

    Yahoo (YHOO) delivers guidance through a slide deck released following its Q2 report. The company expects Q3 revenue (ex-TAC) of $1.06B-$1.1B, below a $1.12B consensus, and 2013 revenue of $4.45B-$4.55B vs. a $4.53B consensus. 2013 adjusted EBITDA is expected to total $1.55B-$1.65B, below 2012's $1.7B, and 2013 non-GAAP operating income is pegged at $900M-$1B. Americas revenue (73% of total) +2% Y/Y in Q2, EMEA -8%, Asia-Pac -8%. Headcount was 11.5K at quarter's end, down 1.1K Y/Y but up 200 Q/Q. Shares -2.2% AH. (Q2 results: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • CASM

    CAS Medical Systems (NASDAQ:CASM) falls 5.7% AH as the company says it is plans to offer...

    CAS Medical Systems (NASDAQ:CASM) falls 5.7% AH as the company says it is plans to offer additional shares. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • VSTM

    Verastem (NASDAQ:VSTM) sinks 8.5% AH as the company announces a proposed public offering. (PR)

    Verastem (NASDAQ:VSTM) sinks 8.5% AH as the company announces a proposed public offering. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • MEAD

    Shares of Mead Instruments (NASDAQ:MEAD) have been halted with news pending. Shares -1.4% AH.

    Shares of Mead Instruments (NASDAQ:MEAD) have been halted with news pending. Shares -1.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM
  • CSX

    More on CSX Corp. (NYSE:CSX) Q2 earnings: Earnings of $535M up 4.5% Y/Y on about-flat revenue of...

    More on CSX Corp. (NYSE:CSX) Q2 earnings: Earnings of $535M up 4.5% Y/Y on about-flat revenue of $3.1B. Operating ratio of 68.6% vs. 68.7% a year ago - company reiterates goal of high 60s through 2015, mid-60s thereafter. Company expects FY2013 EPS to be flat from 2012, then growing 10-15% per year through 2015. CC tomorrow at 8:30 ET. Shares +2.7% AH. (8-K)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 4 Comments
  • GSK

    A high-level Chinese executive for GlaxoSmithKline (GSK -1.4%) appeared to be confirming bribery...

    A high-level Chinese executive for GlaxoSmithKline (GSK -1.4%) appeared to be confirming bribery allegations against the company in an interview yesterday on Chinese state-controlled television. Liang Hong, GSK's China operations manager - and one of four Chinese executives being detained as part of a probe into the company - described for viewers how staffers would allegedly organize conferences that never happened and divert the money to bribe government officials, hospitals and medical personnel to get them to use its products.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ZAGG

    Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG) warns it expects Q2 revenue of $51M, well below a $59.3M consensus. 2013...

    Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG) warns it expects Q2 revenue of $51M, well below a $59.3M consensus. 2013 revenue guidance is lowered to $245M-$252, below a $273.7M consensus.The mobile accessory maker blames a lack of major new device launches (the Galaxy S4 doesn't count?), slower-than-expected retail distribution expansion, and European softness. The latter two trends are expected to continue in 2H. Shares are halted. (Q1 miss: I, II)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • PCG

    Pacific Gas & Electric (PCG +0.4%) spikes higher into the close on heavy volume on reports...

    Pacific Gas & Electric (PCG +0.4%) spikes higher into the close on heavy volume on reports that the CPUC is saying the utility provider should pay a $300M fine for its San Bruno pipeline explosion.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • NTR

    Agrium (AGU -2.2%) and Potash (POT -3%) are finishing lower after Mosaic (MOS -3.6%) reports...

    Agrium (AGU -2.2%) and Potash (POT -3%) are finishing lower after Mosaic (MOS -3.6%) reports in-line May quarter EPS to go with a revenue beat, as weak prices offset strong potash/phosphate sales. Mosaic also issued soft price guidance for the August quarter, made cautious remarks about Indian demand (citing subsidy cuts), and hinted Chinese customers are looking for lower prices. "Chinese buyers will be sorely tempted to pull the trigger if we go below anything where we're at today." The company plans to run its Canadian mines at less than 75% of capacity this quarter, ostensibly for maintenance. (Mosaic transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 5 Comments
  • CSX

    CSX (NYSE:CSX): Q2 EPS of $0.52 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $3.1B beats by $0.1B. Shares +5.1%...

    CSX (NYSE:CSX): Q2 EPS of $0.52 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $3.1B beats by $0.1B. Shares +5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • NAVB

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB +2.3%) is set to close higher after announcing that the...

    Navidea Biopharmaceuticals (NAVB +2.3%) is set to close higher after announcing that the Australian Imaging, Biomarker & Lifestyle Flagship Study of Ageing intends to switch to using NAVB's Fluorine-18 labeled amyloid imaging candidate, NAV4694, for its research initiative on Alzheimer's disease and mild cognitive impairment.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • NYMX

    Nymox Pharmaceutical (NYMX +6.4%) pops on an upbeat article out of Seeking Alpha, saying the...

    Nymox Pharmaceutical (NYMX +6.4%) pops on an upbeat article out of Seeking Alpha, saying the company may be the next unknown biotech to ramp higher. The blog points out the company is in the early stages of marketing AlzheimAlert, NicAlert and TobacAlert, which are diagnostic tests for diagnosing Alheimer's disease and measuring tobacco exposure, all of which may have significant upside potential. Trials are set to close late this year, and the window to invest while it's relatively unknown is closing.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • MDAS

    Demand for MedAssets' (MDAS +3.7%) "capabilities will grow as healthcare reform progresses,"...

    Demand for MedAssets' (MDAS +3.7%) "capabilities will grow as healthcare reform progresses," Jefferies says, initiating the "cheap" shares at Buy and setting a $23 price target. The company's "comprehensive and innovative suite of solutions" should be valuable for hospitals coping with a variety of challenges. Analyst Sean Dodge sees long-term revenue growth of 8%+ and adjusted EPS growth of 13-14% going forward.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • SCLN

    SciClone Pharmaceuticals (SCLN +5.8%) gets a big boost today from an upgrade to Buy from Hold at...

    SciClone Pharmaceuticals (SCLN +5.8%) gets a big boost today from an upgrade to Buy from Hold at Aegis Capital. The firm also set a $9 price target. The stock has had a solid run recently, gaining 12% over the past week.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • CWTR

    Retailer Coldwater Creek (CWTR +5.7%) rises markedly on the session. Perhaps helping the cause...

    Retailer Coldwater Creek (CWTR +5.7%) rises markedly on the session. Perhaps helping the cause is SA Pro contributor Money Investor who, in a still-embargoed article published this morning, calls the stock a "potential lotto ticket" akin to "buying a long-term call option [with no] time decay."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • NLS

    Nautilus (NLS -7.3%) suffers through a rough session after B. Riley downgrades the shares to...

    Nautilus (NLS -7.3%) suffers through a rough session after B. Riley downgrades the shares to Neutral from Buy with a $10 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • HCA

    Some fellow hospital operators are reaping the benefits of HCA's (HCA +5%) upbeat Q2...

    Some fellow hospital operators are reaping the benefits of HCA's (HCA +5%) upbeat Q2 projections: Tenet Healthcare (THC +3.6%), Community Health (CYH +2%).

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • TSLA

    The selloff in Tesla (TSLA -14.5%) gathers momentum following Goldman running the numbers and...

    The selloff in Tesla (TSLA -14.5%) gathers momentum following Goldman running the numbers and finding the stock deserves its valuation only in the best of scenarios. Volume in the shares today looks like it will end up at about 4x the average level.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM | 57 Comments
  • GRFS

    Grifols (GRFS -1.6%) says that Aradigm (OTC:ARDM) has received shareholder approval for its...

    Grifols (GRFS -1.6%) says that Aradigm (OTC:ARDM) has received shareholder approval for its license agreement giving GRFS access to Aradigm's proprietary formulations of inhaled ciprofloxacin, which is used for the treatment of severe respiratory diseases, including non-cystic fibrosis bronchiectasis. In conjunction with the licensing agreement, GRFS will acquire 35% of Aradigm's common stock at a price per share of $0.124 for a total investment of approximately $26M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 1 Comment
  • JOEZ

    Joe's Jeans (JOEZ -19.4%) is having a rough go of it Tuesday after reporting Q2 earnings and...

    Joe's Jeans (JOEZ -19.4%) is having a rough go of it Tuesday after reporting Q2 earnings and announcing the $97.6M acquisition of Hudson Clothing Monday evening. Roth Capital (PT $1.60 from $2.50), B. Riley (PT $1.65 from $2.15), and Sidoti all cut the shares to Neutral today following the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • XONE

    3D printing stocks are diving today as investors take profits on a number of volatile tech names...

    3D printing stocks are diving today as investors take profits on a number of volatile tech names - ExOne (XONE -12.8%) is the biggest casualty, but 3D Systems (DDD -3.3%), Stratasys (SSYS -5.3%), and Proto Labs (PRLB -3.6%) aren't unscathed either. ExOne is down 17% over the last 2 days, following BB&T's downgrade to Hold; the firm isn't sold on recent M&A speculation. Short interests for industry names have been growing; 34.4% and 28.7% of ExOne and 3D Systems' floats were respectively shorted as of June 28.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:43 PM | 5 Comments
  • DWA

    Dreamworks' (DWA -5.5%) Turbo opens tomorrow and the stock is sliding ahead of the release....

    Dreamworks' (DWA -5.5%) Turbo opens tomorrow and the stock is sliding ahead of the release. Perhaps weighing on the shares is negative commentary out of Stifel, where analysts see the film missing their $175M domestic box office estimates. The new projection for the film is $135M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • PTCT

    PTC Therapeutics (PTCT -1.8%) is volatile today on heavy volume. Traders are attributing the...

    PTC Therapeutics (PTCT -1.8%) is volatile today on heavy volume. Traders are attributing the action to Wedbush initiating the stock earlier with an Outperform rating and a hefty $55 price target. The firm thinks that the market has broadly overlooked ataluren's efficacy in Phase IIb trials in nmDMD, and the confirmatory trial is highly likely to yield a positive-read out in mid-2015. Wedbush's new coverage comes on the coattails of Credit Suisse, who started the shares with an Outperform yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • FST

    Forest Oil (FST +10.5%) logs double-digit gains after yesterday's strong session, bringing the...

    Forest Oil (FST +10.5%) logs double-digit gains after yesterday's strong session, bringing the two-day rally to 16% as investors cheer the company's plans to divest assets in the Texas Panhandle. Simmons & Co. believes proceeds from a potential sale could come in at around $1.06B, while Baird says a deal could bring in between $900M-1B, according to TheStreet. For its part, Zeits Energy Analytics says only an offer above $1.5B would "justify FST's stock price."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • MPC

    Energy (XLE -1.1%) is the worst performing S&P sector today with refiners taking the biggest...

    Energy (XLE -1.1%) is the worst performing S&P sector today with refiners taking the biggest hit following Marathon Petroleum's (MPC -4.9%) profit warning, which came on the heels of Valero's (VLO -2%) warning a few days ago as higher oil prices alongside flattish product pricing isn't a great combination. Others: Phillips 66 (PSX -3.3%), Tesoro (TSO -2.6%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • DNKN

    Dunkin Brands (DNKN -1.4%) slips on a couple of tepid ratings calls today: JPMorgan reiterates...

    Dunkin Brands (DNKN -1.4%) slips on a couple of tepid ratings calls today: JPMorgan reiterates its Neutral rating on the stock, however it did raise its price target to $45 from $40. Also, Stifel Nicolaus initiates coverage with a Hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • MOS

    Unfavorable conditions in India could continue for up to a year, says Mosaic (MOS -3.5%) CEO Jim...

    Unfavorable conditions in India could continue for up to a year, says Mosaic (MOS -3.5%) CEO Jim Prokopanko, believing it will take until another election for the government to rebalance fertilizer subsidies. "They know they've got a deficit to be tamed, and they've chosen, if ham-handedly, to reduce payments for potash and phosphate imports." (earnings earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:04 PM
  • HMA

    Health Management Associates (HMA -1.2%) is again urging its shareholders to reject Glenview...

    Health Management Associates (HMA -1.2%) is again urging its shareholders to reject Glenview Capital's efforts to overhaul the hospital operator's board, calling the hedge fund's actions an "unnecessary distraction."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • SHFL

    Midday top 10 gainers: SHFL +22%. SOL +20%. OTC:ESMC +19%. NYMX +15%. NTLS +15%. DRAM +14%. FST...

    Midday top 10 gainers: SHFL +22%. SOL +20%. OTC:ESMC +19%. NYMX +15%. NTLS +15%. DRAM +14%. FST +12%. STP +11%. EPZM +11%. LDK +9%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: JOEZ -22%. BBGI -19%. HSII -16%. KOOL -16%. ADUS -14%. HGSH -12%. STMP -11%. XONE -10%. LQDT -9%. ENG -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • MPO

    Midstates Petroleum (MPO +1.8%) gets a lift from reports that CEO John Crum purchased 10K shares...

    Midstates Petroleum (MPO +1.8%) gets a lift from reports that CEO John Crum purchased 10K shares today at $6.05, bringing his stake to 1,281,301 shares. Crum has been an active buyer lately, accumulating 45K shares just since the end of May, all in the mid-$6 range.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM
  • SIGA

    SIGA Technologies (SIGA +5.5%) rises after saying it qualifies for a $79M payments after...

    SIGA Technologies (SIGA +5.5%) rises after saying it qualifies for a $79M payments after delivering ~590K courses of the smallpox drug Arestvyr to the government's Strategic National Stockpile. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo (QIHU -4.4%) slides as investors mull the impact of Baidu's (BIDU +4.9%) purchase of...

    Qihoo (QIHU -4.4%) slides as investors mull the impact of Baidu's (BIDU +4.9%) purchase of Chinese app store owner 91 Wireless on Qihoo's rival Mobile Assistant app store. Baidu will likely try to bundle 91's app store with its existing arsenal of mobile apps/services for OEMs, and also pitch its developer partners on publishing their apps to the store. Stifel is defending Qihoo: the firm thinks Mobile Assistant handled more downloads than 91 Wireless in the 6 months ending Jan. '13 (7B vs. 6.2B). Meanwhile, ABR defends the steep price Baidu paid: it thinks 91's rapid growth could lead it to contribute $0.11-$0.17 to 2014 EPS.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • BIIB

    Biogen Idec (BIIB -0.9%) slips after reporting late yesterday that the U.S. Court of Appeals has...

    Biogen Idec (BIIB -0.9%) slips after reporting late yesterday that the U.S. Court of Appeals has declined its request for a re-hearing of its patent infringement case against GlaxoSmithKline's (NYSE:GSK) Arzerra. The suit was brought against GSK by Genentech and BIIB in 2010, claiming that Arzerra infringed its patent covering methods of treating Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia with CD20 antibodies. The court upheld the earlier judgment in favor of GSK, saying the patent was invalid and unenforceable.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • ARO

    Aeropostale (ARO -2.6%) slides as Goldman's Lindsay Drucker Mann says the company "may have gone...

    Aeropostale (ARO -2.6%) slides as Goldman's Lindsay Drucker Mann says the company "may have gone too far, too fast" and too risky with its new floor set. Long story short: The mix looks too far oriented away from "basics" and towards "fashion", the opening price points look too high, and the company "will be at a disadvantage to a formidable fast-fashion competitive set." A Sell rating is reiterated (price target $8).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • GLUU

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +5.9%) rallies after SA contributor Kelvin M. analyzes the Q2 performance of...

    Glu Mobile (GLUU +5.9%) rallies after SA contributor Kelvin M. analyzes the Q2 performance of Glu's games on App Store charts, and relies on the numbers to predict the company will beat revenue estimates when its reports on Aug. 6, albeit not by a huge amount. The author notes Glu's most popular title, Frontline Commando: D-Day, ranked well in App Store charts throughout Q2, and that Glu's games are faring well in China. At the same time, he cautions "there is no real indicator showing that Glu will have an exceptional quarter." The author is more upbeat about 2H, citing Glu's plans to publish six 3rd-party titles. (Chinese sales) (first publishing title)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 4 Comments
  • GOLD

    Randgold Resources (GOLD +4.3%) jumps as the firm discloses BlackRock's stake in the company has...

    Randgold Resources (GOLD +4.3%) jumps as the firm discloses BlackRock's stake in the company has surpassed the 15% mark.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • ARIA

    Cancer drug developer Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -2.6%) slides this morning after Credit Suisse...

    Cancer drug developer Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA -2.6%) slides this morning after Credit Suisse initiated the shares with a less than exuberant Neutral rating and $22 price target. The stock has put up a power-charged run over the past couple sessions with decent volume on the back of the Roche/Alexion takeover chatter, having gained over 11% since last Thursday.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • DCP

    DCP Midstream (DPM -2.9%) slides after Credit Suisse cuts shares to Underperform. The gas...

    DCP Midstream (DPM -2.9%) slides after Credit Suisse cuts shares to Underperform. The gas pipeline owner delivers its Q2 report on Aug. 6.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • DFRG

    Del Frisco's Restaurant (DFRG -6.6%) falls sharply after filing a registration statement for a...

    Del Frisco's Restaurant (DFRG -6.6%) falls sharply after filing a registration statement for a proposed 5M share secondary. (Earlier: DFRG reports Q2 earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • DVA

    DaVita (DVA -1.8%) slips as Goldman cuts the shares to Sell from Neutral (price target $110). A...

    DaVita (DVA -1.8%) slips as Goldman cuts the shares to Sell from Neutral (price target $110). A "a meaningful contribution from future growth drivers [is] several years away," analyst Matthew Borsch says, adding that "growth in the physician integrated care model has been harder to achieve than expected." Like Deutsche, Goldman thinks 2014 estimates may be difficult to hit and with the shares back to pre-CMS rate announcement levels, it may be a good time to take some off the table.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • GOGO

    Gogo (GOGO -7.4%) is diving on underwriter coverage day, even though the in-flight Wi-Fi...

    Gogo (GOGO -7.4%) is diving on underwriter coverage day, even though the in-flight Wi-Fi services provider has caught 3 bullish ratings (William Blair, JPMorgan, and UBS) to go with 1 neutral one (Morgan Stanley). JPMorgan praises Gogo for giving domestic airlines "the fastest and lowest cost entry to in-flight broadband," thinks it has only a handful of credible international rivals, and expects services such as Gogo Vision to increase its value. But Morgan Stanley thinks Gogo's growth and barriers to entry are offset by low take rates, something attributed to the limitations of current tech (i.e. low bandwidth and high prices). The firm also sees tougher competition abroad. (IPO day fall)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • HCA

    HCA Holdings (HCA +3.7%) rises following upbeat Q2 guidance, with the hospital operator...

    HCA Holdings (HCA +3.7%) rises following upbeat Q2 guidance, with the hospital operator estimating: EPS of $0.91 vs $0.85 last year and consensus for adjusted EPS of $0.78; revenue of $8.45B vs $8.11B and 8.43B; pretax profit of $806M vs $699M last year; adjusted EBITDA of $1.69B vs $1.57B; admission of over 1% vs +0.1% in Q1. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • TSLA

    Goldman's Patrick Archambault isn't buying Northland Capital's $230 Tesla (TSLA -4.1%) price...

    Goldman's Patrick Archambault isn't buying Northland Capital's $230 Tesla (TSLA -4.1%) price target. Archambault's bull case assumes a 3.5% global market share in the entry- and mid- luxury categories, equating to 200K units sold. Applying a 15.2% operating margin implies $113/ share. The bear case (which assumes total sales of 105K units, operating margins of 14.6%, and a 20x p/e multiple) values the stock at just $58. Goldman's target price is $84, only 34% below Monday's close.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 59 Comments
  • BIDU

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes: 1) Baidu (BIDU +4.7%) has been upgraded to Neutral by...

    A roundup of tech analyst ratings changes: 1) Baidu (BIDU +4.7%) has been upgraded to Neutral by Citi following the 91 Wireless deal. 2) Sonus (SONS +4.7%) has been upgraded to Buy by Lazard. 3) Stamps.com (STMP -7.7%) has been cut to Neutral by B. Riley. 4) Move (MOVE +2.9%) has been started at Overweight by Stephens. 5) Cavium (CAVM -2%) has been started at Reduce by Nomura. 6) Perfect World (PWRD +1.8%) has been upgraded to Buy by Citi. 7) Trina (TSL -0.5%) has been cut to Underperform by Raymond James; shares would be faring worse if not for ReneSola's guidance hike.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • MDGL

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA +5.7%) moves higher after JMP's Mike King upgrades the shares to...

    Synta Pharmaceuticals (SNTA +5.7%) moves higher after JMP's Mike King upgrades the shares to Outperform (price target $11). Here's theStreet's Adam Feurstein with the super cynical take: "If you close your eyes tight, ignore real data, and drink subgroup-flavored Kool-Aid, ganetespib wins." Although some seem to believe a Hazard ratio increase disclosed in early June suggests the drug's effectiveness diminishes over time, there are still bulls to be found besides King. Take Jefferies' Thomas Wei, who still likes ganetespib's efficacy profile.
